page.title: 14HEDGE SURVEY/DATING
page.content:
{DATING} The boundary hedges of Hailes Abbey were dated using the technique of Hooper & Pollard. An average of 7 shrub / tree species was obtained per 30 yard stretch of hedge. This would date the hedges at 677 years, which corresponds quite well with the founding of the monastery in 1246. {SURVEY The following species were found: ELM, ELDER, HAZEL, HAWTHORN, FIELD MAPLE, GUELDER ROSE, SPINDLE, DOGWOOD, SLOE, CHERRY PLUM (Prunus cerasifera), WILD PRIVET, OAK & GOAT WILLOW.
The hedges support a rich invertebrate fauna , notably parasitic hymenoptera, sawflies and beetles.
